data.enText: to hit sb/sth quickly and lightly
Someone tapped at the door.
He was busy tapping away at his computer.

data.chText: 拉尔夫轻轻地拍了拍我的肩膀。
data.enText: Ralph tapped me on the shoulder.
if you tap your fingers, feet, etc. or they tap , you hit them gently against a table, the floor, etc., for example to the rhythm of music

data.chText: 他不停地用手指轻轻敲着桌子。
data.enText: He kept tapping his fingers on the table.

data.chText: 乐曲使得每个人都用脚轻轻打起拍子来。
data.enText: The music set everyone's feet tapping.

data.chText: 利用，开发，发掘（已有的资源、知识等）
data.enText: to make use of a source of energy, knowledge, etc. that already exists

data.chText: 我们需要利用我们现有人员的专业知识。
data.enText: We need to tap the expertise of the people we already have.

data.chText: 这部电影似乎在激发人们对动物的普遍怜惜之情。
data.enText: The movie seems to tap into a general sentimentality about animals.

data.chText: （在电话上）安装窃听器，搭线窃听
data.enText: to fit a device to a telephone so that sb's calls can be listened to secretly

data.chText: 他确信自己的电话在被人窃听。
data.enText: He was convinced his phone was being tapped.
to cut into a tree in order to get liquid from it
to choose sb to do a particular job

data.chText: 理查兹获得委任接替行将退任的主席。
data.enText: Richards has been tapped to replace the retiring chairperson.
to produce a tap n.(6)
tap sb for sth
to persuade sb to give you sth, especially money
tap sth↔in/out

data.chText: 输入，输出（信息、数字、字母等）
data.enText: to put information, numbers, letters, etc. into a machine by pressing buttons

data.chText: 输入你的个人身份识别号码。
data.enText: Tap in your PIN number.
tap sth↔out
to hit a surface gently to the rhythm of music
She tapped out the beat on the table.

data.chText: （用计算机或移动电话）写，敲出，键入
data.enText: to write sth using a computer or a mobile phone/cellphone

data.chText: 我给曼迪发了一条短信。
data.enText: I tapped out a text message to Mandy.
faucet
a device for controlling the flow of water from a pipe into a bath/ bathtub or sink
bath taps
the hot/cold tap (= the tap that hot/cold water comes out of)
Turn the tap on/off .

data.chText: 别把水龙头开着白白流水。
data.enText: Don't leave the tap running.
the sound of a dripping tap
a device for controlling the flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container
a gas tap
beer taps
a light hit with your hand or fingers
a tap at/on the door

data.chText: 他觉得有人轻轻拍他的肩膀便转过身来。
data.enText: He felt a tap on his shoulder and turned round.
an act of fitting a device to a telephone so that sb's telephone calls can be listened to secretly
a phone tap

a speech sound which is produced by striking the tongue quickly and lightly against the part of the mouth behind the upper front teeth. The /t/ in later in American English and the /r/ in very in some British accents are examples of taps .
on tap
available to be used at any time

data.chText: 我们可随时向您提供这种资料。
data.enText: We have this sort of information on tap.

data.chText: （啤酒）装在有旋塞的桶里的，散装的
data.enText: beer that is on tap is in a barrel with a tap on it

data.chText: 协商中；准备中；即将发生
data.enText: something that is on tap is being discussed or prepared and will happen soon

means: 利用，开发，发掘(已有的资源、知识等)
（在电话上）安装窃听器，搭线窃听

ex.chText: 他轻轻地拍了拍我的后背。
ex.enText: He tapped me on the back.
She tapped the table with her fingers.

synonyms.bx: 指用手指等轻叩、轻拍或轻敲，意在引人注意，或表示爱抚等情感。

ex.chText: 他不知道敲她的门是否恰当。
ex.enText: He wondered whether it would be proper to knock at her door.

ex.chText: 我听见他在壁炉架上磕打烟斗。
ex.enText: I heard him knock his pipe out on the mantelpiece.

synonyms.bx: 指用手掌、拳头或硬物用力敲打，以引起他人的注意或重视。

ex.chText: 主席敲桌子要求听众安静。
ex.enText: The chairman rapped on the table for order.
Angrily, she rapped on his window.

ex.chText: 他做数学题遇到困难时总是要敲书桌。
ex.enText: He would rap his fingers on the desk when he had difficulty working out a math problem.

synonyms.bx: 指用指关节、笔等快速轻敲或急拍，意在引人注意或表示某种情感。

data.enText: on tap
available to be used at any time

data.chText: 我们可随时向您提供这种资料。
data.enText: We have this sort of information on tap.

data.chText: （啤酒）装在有旋塞的桶里的，散装的
data.enText: beer that is on tap is in a barrel with a tap on it

data.chText: 协商中；准备中；即将发生
data.enText: something that is on tap is being discussed or prepared and will happen soon
tap sb for sth
to persuade sb to give you sth, especially money
tap sth↔in/out

data.chText: 输入，输出（信息、数字、字母等）
data.enText: to put information, numbers, letters, etc. into a machine by pressing buttons

data.chText: 输入你的个人身份识别号码。
data.enText: Tap in your PIN number.
tap sth↔out
to hit a surface gently to the rhythm of music
She tapped out the beat on the table.

data.chText: （用计算机或移动电话）写，敲出，键入
data.enText: to write sth using a computer or a mobile phone/cellphone

data.chText: 我给曼迪发了一条短信。
data.enText: I tapped out a text message to Mandy.

tr: a light touch or stroke
the act of tapping a telephone or telegraph line to get information
a plug for a bunghole in a cask
a tool for cutting female (internal) screw threads
a small metal plate that attaches to the toe or heel of a shoe (as in tap dancing)
a faucet for drawing water from a pipe or cask
the sound made by a gentle blow
a gentle blow
make a solicitation or entreaty for something
request urgently or persistently
example: Henry IV solicited the Pope for a divorce
My neighbor keeps soliciting money for different charities

tr: draw from
make good use of
example: we must exploit the resources we are given wisely

tr: strike lightly
example: He tapped me on the shoulder

tr: cut a female screw thread with a tap
pierce in order to draw a liquid from
example: tap a maple tree for its syrup

tr: draw (liquor) from a tap
dance and make rhythmic clicking sounds by means of metal plates nailed to the sole of the dance shoes
walk with a tapping sound
make light, repeated taps on a surface
example: he was tapping his fingers on the table impatiently

tr: tap a telephone or telegraph wire to get information
example: The FBI was tapping the phone line of the suspected spy

tr: draw from or dip into to get something
furnish with a tap or spout, so as to be able to draw liquid from it

value.def: A tap is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container, for example on a sink.

example.ex: The honey runs out of a tap at the bottom of the drum.
example.tran: 蜂蜜从鼓形圆桶底部的一个旋塞流出来。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 faucet

value.def: If you tap something, you hit it with a quick light blow or a series of quick light blows.

example.ex: He tapped the table to still the shouts of protest...
example.tran: 他敲了敲桌子，以平息抗议的喧闹声。

example.ex: Tap the eggs gently with a teaspoon to crack the shells...
example.tran: 用茶匙轻敲鸡蛋，让蛋壳开裂。

example.ex: Grace tapped on the bedroom door and went in...
example.tran: 格雷丝轻轻敲了敲卧室的门，走了进去。

example.ex: There was a comfortable-looking clerk on duty, tapping away on a manual typewriter...
example.tran: 有个神态安适的办事员在当班，在手动打字机上啪嗒啪嗒地打着字。

example.ex: To hold the carpet in place, it's a good idea to tap in a few nails temporarily.
example.tran: 要想固定住地毯，临时钉些钉子是个好办法。

example.ex: A tap on the door interrupted him and Sally Pierce came in.
example.tran: 敲门声打断了他，萨莉·皮尔斯走了进来。

value.def: If you tap your fingers or feet, you make a regular pattern of sound by hitting a surface lightly and repeatedly with them, especially while you are listening to music.

example.ex: The song's so catchy it makes you bounce round the living room or tap your feet.
example.tran: 这首歌很动听，听着它你就会不由自主地在客厅里舞动，或是用脚打拍子。

value.tran: (尤指听音乐时，用手指或脚)敲节拍，打拍子

value.def: If you tap a resource or situation, you make use of it by getting from it something that you need or want.

example.ex: He owes his election to having tapped deep public disillusion with professional politicians...
example.tran: 他将自己的当选归因于充分利用了公众对于职业政治家们不再抱希望的心情。

example.ex: The company is tapping shareholders for £15.8 million...
example.tran: 公司要向股东募集 1, 580 万英镑。

example.ex: The Campbell Soup Company says it will try to tap into Japan's rice market.
example.tran: 坎贝尔羹汤公司表示，它将努力开发日本的大米市场。

value.tran: 开发，发掘，利用(资源、形势)

value.def: If someone taps your telephone, they attach a special device to the line so that they can secretly listen to your conversations.

example.ex: The government passed laws allowing the police to tap telephones...
example.tran: 政府通过了允许警方监听电话的法令。

example.ex: We suspected the telephone line was tapped.
example.tran: 我们怀疑电话遭人窃听了。

example.ex: He assured MPs that ministers and MPs were not subjected to phone taps.
example.tran: 他向议员们保证，部长和议员的电话不会遭到窃听。

value.def: If drinks are on tap, they come from a tap rather than from a bottle.

example.ex: Filtered water is always on tap, making it very convenient to use.
example.tran: 随时打开龙头都有过滤水，用起来很方便。

value.tran: (饮料)散装的，可随时(打开旋塞)取饮的

value.def: If something is on tap, you can have as much of it as you want whenever you want.

example.ex: The advantage of group holidays is company on tap but time alone if you want it.
example.tran: 团体度假的好处在于，要找人陪伴非常容易，想要独处也行。

value.tran: 可轻松获取;可随时使用

trans: 补篮；低手上篮；将很短的推击击球入洞
轻轻敲击（某物的表面）， 轻击…（某部位）
抽头转换开关；分接头变换器
(饮料)散装的，可随时(打开旋塞)取饮的；可轻松获取;可随时使用
螺孔；塞孔；螺纹孔；放液口；放出口
丝锥；丝攻；螺絲攻；螺丝攻；螺旋式水龙头
